title: Aage se right
descriptions:
'Aage Se Right' is a 2009 Indian comedy film. The movie revolves around Dinkar Waghmare (Shreyas Talpade), a sub-inspector in the Mumbai police department who aspires to be a part of the elite Encounter Squad. Dinkar is obsessed with becoming a hero and is desperate to make a name for himself.

Dinkar stumbles upon a gun that has been lost by a group of terrorists. Unaware of its origin, he decides to use the gun to gain fame by killing a notorious gangster. However, things take a turn when the gun is discovered by a struggling filmmaker, Ravi (Kay Kay Menon), who decides to use it as a plot twist in his film.

Meanwhile, a terrorist named Amol (Bhushan) wants the gun back and will stop at nothing to retrieve it. As Dinkar and Ravi navigate their respective worlds, they find themselves entangled in a series of misadventures, leading to a chaotic and unpredictable climax.

'Aage Se Right' is a satirical comedy that pokes fun at the Indian film industry, the police force, and the societal obsession with fame and heroism. The movie features a talented ensemble cast, witty dialogue, and a host of humorous situations, making it an entertaining watch.
